phrase: Albert is a 62-year-old male, with a past medical history significant for depression, type 2 diabetes, and kidney transplant, who is here today for emergency room follow-up.
I wasn’t really staying on top of my blood sugar readings, and I felt kinda woozy over the weekend.

My mother was in the hospital the last week. She had a bit of a fall and had to do a hip replacement. She’s feeling better but we have been just grabbing meals at the cafeteria or picking up fast food on our way home, and I just really wasn’t monitoring what I was eating.
Your hemoglobin A1c is about 8, and that’s a little high.
I want you to continue monitoring your blood sugar and let me know how they’re running because we might have to adjust that further.
Increase your Lantus to 20 units at night.
My wife got me into meditation recently, and I find that relaxing. I’d like to continue that, at least for a couple more months and see how it goes.
I’ve been pretty diligent about it, following doctor’s orders; it’s been pretty good so far.
I deny any chest pain, shortness of breath, lightheadedness, or dizziness.
I want to hold off on any therapy. I’d like to continue meditation for a couple more months and see how it goes.
The patient understands and agrees with the recommended medical treatment plan.
